nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
## Define your parameters
- Find your telegram chat id to get notified in a private channel (bot must be added as admin)
- Create an account on [Beehiiv]() and get your api key
- Get your publication id from your newsletter which will be parsed in the "Add subscriber" url endpoint

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## How it works
This workflow allows you to add each meeting guest into Google Sheets, adding one row for each guest and consequently adding those users to your newsletter on Beehiiv.

## Set up steps

- Create an account on [Cal.com]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
- Create a new webhook on [Cal.com]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} and send a test event to the URL that appears in the first node. You will get test data that you can pin to set the rest of the workflow.
- For [Beehiiv]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} you will need to get the publication id from the account plus the api key. You will find those on your account settings. Define the publication id on the "set data" node, together with your Telegram chat id, if you wish to notify yourself in a private channel when a new subscriber is added.

Enjoy building!

Aitor
[1 Node]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Meeting booked - to newsletter and CRM

## Overview
Automated workflow: Meeting booked - to newsletter and CRM. This workflow integrates 8 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, calTrigger, telegram, splitOut. It contains 13 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 13
- **Node Types**: 8
- **Error Handling**: âœ… Implemented
- **Security**: âœ… Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: âœ… Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Split Attendees**: splitOut
- **Add users**: googleSheets
- **on New Booking**: calTrigger
- **Add subscriber**: httpRequest
- **Set Attendee**: set
- **notify in channel**: telegram
- **set data**: set
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Error Handler**: stopAndError
- ... and 3 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
